intro: Stylidium coroniforme subsp. coroniforme, commonly known as the crown-shaped stickleback, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, erect, spiny stems. The plant produces small, bright red or orange flowers that are clustered in spikes, often resembling a crown. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
